name: Does the countermark contain the letter 'N' followed by the letter 'A' when viewed in correct orientation?

children.name: Do the 'N' and 'A' letters touch at the angular point of the 'N' at its base?
Is the peak of the letter 'A' higher than the topmost angular point of the letter 'N'?
When the letter 'N' is oriented correctly, is it preceded by the letter 'A'?
Does the first vertical stroke of the letter 'N' end lower than the lowest point of the letter 'A'?
Does the countermark contain the letter 'N' followed by the letter 'H' when viewed in correct orientation?
Is the first vertical stroke of the letter 'H' bowed?
